data.name: command_help_text
data.value: Open {0} configuration menu. Use "{1} <toggle|on|off>" to enable/disable. Add 'p' to the command to also save the state (<togglep|onp|offp>)

data.name: faq_how_does_this_work_entry
data.value: The current implementation reads the minimap data and displays it on the monodimensional compass. This also works when the minimap HUD element is hidden.

data.name: faq_how_does_this_work_header
data.value: How does this work?

data.name: faq_limitations_header
data.value: What are the current limitations?

data.name: faq_limitations_entry
data.value: Because of the current implementation, only data the minimap knows about can be displayed. This usually means icons in the immediate vicinity of the player plus objective markers for the current tracked quests. Different zoom levels of the minimap influence not the overall distance but how soon the 'arrow' icon for tracked quests turns into a more proper goal icon (e.g. area circle). I therefore recommend to zoom out as much as possible but this is entirely up to preference.

data.name: faq_wrong_placed_icons_header
data.value: The icons are all placed wrong, what gives?

data.name: faq_wrong_placed_icons_entry
data.value: The current math only supports a minimap which is locked (meaning north is always upwards). The minimap can be locked with a click on the cog on the minimap HUD element. (In the case of Material UI, its a lock, not a cog.)

data.name: faq_resize_header
data.value: How can I resize the compass?

data.name: faq_resize_entry
data.value: The icons on the compass can be resized in this settings menu (other tab), the overall size of the compass (e.g. the height) is influenced by the global font scale set in Dalamud's settings. After modifying the font scale in Dalamud, a compass' settings needs to be changed (e.g. disable/enable the compass) to recalculate the size.

data.name: faq_fate_no_filter_circles_header
data.value: Why does filtering FATE markers does not filter out the FATE area circles?

data.name: faq_fate_no_filter_circles_entry
data.value: Currently, there is no way to distinguish between FATE circles and quest circles. Each circle is therefore treated as belonging to a quest-in-progress and therefore always shown.

data.name: faq_use_map_header
data.value: What means using the map, and not the minimap, as source?

data.name: faq_use_map_entry
data.value: The map (the one you can open via clicking on the minimap) has more data points of the current area and therefore, in theory, allows the compass to show more icons. When checking this setting, the compass will use the data from the mapinstead of the minimap to show the icons. This comes with its own trade-offs, however.

data.name: faq_use_map_tradeoffs_header
data.value: What trade-offs are there for using the map as source?

data.name: faq_use_map_tradeoffs_entry
data.value: The map needs to be open for the compass to be able to use it as the source. The map can, however, be made 100%% transparent via the settings and/or made very small. It also does not need to be in focus, only open. Furthermore, gathering points are only available when using the minimap as source. Last but not least, querying the map instead of the minimap is a more taxing operation and needs more resources.

data.name: faq_compass_gone_header
data.value: The compass is wrong/missing after a DeepDungeon/Chocobo race/Lord of Verminion match etc.?

data.name: faq_compass_gone_entry
data.value: Please type '/compass on' or toggle the compass in the settings tab to reset the internal cache. Visiting a DeepDungeon/Chocobo race etc. unfortunately kills the mini map completely and as such the cache needs to be reset for the compass to work again.

data.name: tab_header_faq
data.value: FAQ

data.name: fresh_install_note
data.value: Thank you for installing the Compass plugin. Please have a look at the configuration, especially at the FAQ section, for a quick explanation of the current caveats and settings needed for the compass to work. May Hydaelyn protect you in your adventures across Eorzea and beyond!

data.name: fresh_install_note_confirm_button
data.value: Continue the adventure

data.name: filter_tab_text
data.value: Filter ... on compass.

data.name: hide_compass_text
data.value: Hide Compass when ... window is open.

data.name: please_read_faq
data.value: Please read the FAQ for what that means and caveats.
